medium: Pen and brown ink on ivory laid paper
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
inscribed:
Inscribed verso, partial draft of letter, in brown
ink: . . . partenza per la fiera di Sinigalia il latt.ore
di . . . /. . . mio paiesano, in tempo che mio fratello si . . . /
. . . , io per lui rispondo alla lettera di V.S. del . . . /. . . ,
che si é ricevuto la misura del quadro . . . /. . . me ella
desidera, e perhó stando la . . . / . . . dei frati, ho pensato
per melio servire V.S. di . . . /. . . che si ponga al ordine un
quadro app[osito] . . . /. . . stando che le impremiture
portarebero . . . /. . . in circa di tempo, prima di poter
valer [?] . . . /. . . ne piliaró uno al quanto piú grande . . . /
. . . daró alla misura mandatami e quand[o] . . . /. . . daró
principio al opra, valendomi del . . . /Cento

makers.displaydate: 1591–1666; born Cento, Italy; died Bologna, Italy
makers.displaymaker: Guercino (Giovanni Francesco Barbieri), 1591–1666; born Cento, Italy; died Bologna, Italy

texts.textentryhtml: Guglielmo Libri Carucci dalla Sommaja (1803–1869); [his sale, Sotheby, Wilkinson & Hodge, London, July 25, 1862, lot 203]; John Campbell, Marquis of Breadalbane (1796–1862); [possibly Willis & Sotheran, London]; [Christie’s, London, June 4, 1886, lot 127]; [E. Parsons & Sons, London, 1920]; purchased by Dan Fellows Platt (1873-1937), 1920; bequeathed to the Princeton University Art Museum, 1938.
texts.remarks: From accession card. Reformatted by Emma Holter, July 2025, summer P&D Intern

texts.textentryhtml: The centrality of the human figure in the history of Italian drawing —as an object of scrutiny, idealization, and fragmentation—is captured in these two female nudes by Guercino and Modigliani. Repurposing the other side of a sheet of paper previously used for a business letter, Guercino employed his economical pen and ink technique, consisting of strategically clustered parallel hatching, to conjure up this seductive young woman. While her posture and drapery suggest a heroine from Classical mythology or literature, her precise identity remains elusive.

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
bibliography.citation: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977)., Vol. 1: p. 111, no. 328 (illustrated in Vol. 2 under the same catalog number)

bibliography.boilertext: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014).
bibliography.citation: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014)., p. 143, cat. no. 59; p. 145 (illus.)
